title: The Real Buddy Holly Story
description:
In 1985 Paul McCartney teamed up with BBC-2's Arena television program to produce a 65 minute film to mark the tenth anniversary of "Buddy Holly Week" which McCartney launched in 1976, the year in which he aquired the Buddy Holly publishing catalogue of songs.  The special was first aired on September 12, 1985.  When issued on video tape in 1987 the special was expanded to almost 90 minutes.  This is the expanded version transferred from VHS.
Produced and hosted by Paul McCartney, this entertaining and enlightening show is the most definitive biography of Buddy Holly ever assembled, featuring interviews with members of The Crickets and many of Buddy Holly's family and friends who knew him best as well as some words from Keith Richards about Holly's impact on the Stones and other British acts from the 60's. Includes many rare performances.  Paul McCartney also performs several of Buddy Holly's songs.

NTSC
